5550
5551int stb_feq(char *s1, char *s2)
5552{
5553 FILE *f = stb__fopen(s1, "rb");
5554 FILE *g = stb__fopen(s2, "rb");
5555
5556 if (f == NULL || g == NULL) {
5557 if (f) fclose(f);
5558 if (g) fclose(g);
5559 return f == g;
5560 }
5561
5562 // feq is faster because it shortcuts if they're different length
5563 if (stb_filelen(f) != stb_filelen(g)) {
5564 fclose(f);
5565 fclose(g);
5566 return 0;
5567 }
5568
5569 return !stb_fcmp_core(f,g);
5570}
5571
5572static stb_ptrmap *stb__files;
5573
5574typedef struct
5575{
5576 char *temp_name;
5577 char *name;
5578 int errors;
5579} stb__file_data;
5580
5581static FILE *stb__open_temp_file(char *temp_name, char *src_name, const char *mode)
5582{
5583 size_t p;
5584#ifdef _MSC_VER
5585 int j;
5586#endif
5587 FILE *f;
5588 // try to generate a temporary file in the same directory
5589 p = strlen(src_name)-1;
5590 while (p > 0 && src_name[p] != '/' && src_name[p] != '\\'
5591 && src_name[p] != ':' && src_name[p] != '~')
5592 --p;
5593 ++p;
5594
5595 memcpy(temp_name, src_name, p);
5596
5597 #ifdef _MSC_VER
5598 // try multiple times to make a temp file... just in
5599 // case some other process makes the name first
5600 for (j=0; j < 32; ++j) {
5601 stb_p_strcpy_s(temp_name+p, 65536, "stmpXXXXXX");
5602 if (!stb_p_mktemp(temp_name))
5603 return 0;
5604
5605 f = stb_p_fopen(temp_name, mode);
5606 if (f != NULL)
5607 break;
5608 }
5609 #else
5610 {
5611 stb_p_strcpy_s(temp_name+p, 65536, "stmpXXXXXX");
5612 #ifdef __MINGW32__
5613 int fd = open(stb_p_mktemp(temp_name), O_RDWR);
5614 #else
5615 int fd = mkstemp(temp_name);
5616 #endif
5617 if (fd == -1) return NULL;
5618 f = fdopen(fd, mode);
5619 if (f == NULL) {
5620 unlink(temp_name);
5621 close(fd);
5622 return NULL;
5623 }
5624 }
5625 #endif
5626 return f;
5627}
5628
5629
5630FILE * stb_fopen(char *filename, const char *mode)
5631{
5632 FILE *f;
5633 char name_full[4096];
5634 char temp_full[sizeof(name_full) + 12];
5635
5636 // @TODO: if the file doesn't exist, we can also use the fastpath here
5637 if (mode[0] != 'w' && !strchr(mode, '+'))
5638 return stb__fopen(filename, mode);
5639
5640 // save away the full path to the file so if the program
5641 // changes the cwd everything still works right! unix has
5642 // better ways to do this, but we have to work in windows
5643 name_full[0] = '\0'; // stb_fullpath reads name_full[0]
5644 if (stb_fullpath(name_full, sizeof(name_full), filename)==0)
5645 return 0;
5646
5647 f = stb__open_temp_file(temp_full, name_full, mode);
5648 if (f != NULL) {
5649 stb__file_data *d = (stb__file_data *) malloc(sizeof(*d));
5650 if (!d) { assert(0); /* NOTREACHED */fclose(f); return NULL; }
5651 if (stb__files == NULL) stb__files = stb_ptrmap_create();
5652 d->temp_name = stb_p_strdup(temp_full);
5653 d->name = stb_p_strdup(name_full);
5654 d->errors = 0;
5655 stb_ptrmap_add(stb__files, f, d);
5656 return f;
5657 }
5658
5659 return NULL;
5660}
5661
5662int stb_fclose(FILE *f, int keep)
5663{
5664 stb__file_data *d;
5665
5666 int ok = STB_FALSE;
5667 if (f == NULL) return 0;
5668
5669 if (ferror(f))
5670 keep = stb_keep_no;
5671
5672 fclose(f);
5673
5674 if (stb__files && stb_ptrmap_remove(stb__files, f, (void **) &d)) {
5675 if (stb__files->count == 0) {
5676 stb_ptrmap_destroy(stb__files);
5677 stb__files = NULL;
5678 }
5679 } else
5680 return STB_TRUE; // not special
5681
5682 if (keep == stb_keep_if_different) {
5683 // check if the files are identical
5684 if (stb_feq(d->name, d->temp_name)) {
5685 keep = stb_keep_no;
5686 ok = STB_TRUE; // report success if no change
5687 }
5688 }
5689
5690 if (keep == stb_keep_no) {
5691 remove(d->temp_name);
5692 } else {
5693 if (!stb_fexists(d->name)) {
5694 // old file doesn't exist, so just move the new file over it
5695 stb_rename(d->temp_name, d->name);
5696 } else {
5697 // don't delete the old file yet in case there are troubles! First rename it!
5698 char preserved_old_file[4096];
5699
5700 // generate a temp filename in the same directory (also creates it, which we don't need)
5701 FILE *dummy = stb__open_temp_file(preserved_old_file, d->name, "wb");
5702 if (dummy != NULL) {
5703 // we don't actually want the open file
5704 fclose(dummy);
5705
5706 // discard what we just created
5707 remove(preserved_old_file); // if this fails, there's nothing we can do, and following logic handles it as best as possible anyway
5708
5709 // move the existing file to the preserved name
5710 if (0 != stb_rename(d->name, preserved_old_file)) { // 0 on success
5711 // failed, state is:
5712 // filename -> old file
5713 // tempname -> new file
5714 // keep tempname around so we don't lose data
5715 } else {
5716 // state is:
5717 // preserved -> old file
5718 // tempname -> new file
5719 // move the new file to the old name
5720 if (0 == stb_rename(d->temp_name, d->name)) {
5721 // state is:
5722 // preserved -> old file
5723 // filename -> new file
5724 ok = STB_TRUE;
5725
5726 // 'filename -> new file' has always been the goal, so clean up
5727 remove(preserved_old_file); // nothing to be done if it fails
5728 } else {
5729 // couldn't rename, so try renaming preserved file back
5730
5731 // state is:
5732 // preserved -> old file
5733 // tempname -> new file
5734 stb_rename(preserved_old_file, d->name);
5735 // if the rename failed, there's nothing more we can do
5736 }
5737 }
5738 } else {
5739 // we couldn't get a temp filename. do this the naive way; the worst case failure here
5740 // leaves the filename pointing to nothing and the new file as a tempfile
5741 remove(d->name);
5742 stb_rename(d->temp_name, d->name);
5743 }
5744 }
5745 }
5746
5747 free(d->temp_name);
5748 free(d->name);
5749 free(d);
5750
5751 return ok;
5752}
5753
5754int stb_copyfile(char *src, char *dest)
5755{
5756 char raw_buffer[1024];
5757 char *buffer;
5758 int buf_size = 65536;
5759
5760 FILE *f, *g;
5761
5762 // if file already exists at destination, do nothing
5763 if (stb_feq(src, dest)) return STB_TRUE;
5764
5765 // open file
5766 f = stb__fopen(src, "rb");
5767 if (f == NULL) return STB_FALSE;
5768
5769 // open file for writing
5770 g = stb__fopen(dest, "wb");
5771 if (g == NULL) {
5772 fclose(f);
5773 return STB_FALSE;
5774 }
5775
5776 buffer = (char *) malloc(buf_size);
5777 if (buffer == NULL) {
5778 buffer = raw_buffer;
5779 buf_size = sizeof(raw_buffer);
5780 }
5781
5782 while (!feof(f)) {
5783 size_t n = fread(buffer, 1, buf_size, f);
5784 if (n != 0)
5785 fwrite(buffer, 1, n, g);
5786 }
5787
5788 fclose(f);
5789 if (buffer != raw_buffer)
5790 free(buffer);
5791
5792 fclose(g);
5793 return STB_TRUE;
5794}
5795
5796// varlen:
5797// v' = (v >> 31) + (v < 0 ? ~v : v)<<1; // small abs(v) => small v'
5798// output v as big endian v'+k for v' <= k:
5799// 1 byte : v' <= 0x00000080 ( -64 <= v < 64) 7 bits
5800// 2 bytes: v' <= 0x00004000 (-8192 <= v < 8192) 14 bits
5801// 3 bytes: v' <= 0x00200000 21 bits
5802// 4 bytes: v' <= 0x10000000 28 bits
5803// the number of most significant 1-bits in the first byte
5804// equals the number of bytes after the first
5805
5806#define stb__varlen_xform(v) (v<0 ? (~v << 1)+1 : (v << 1))
5807
5808int stb_size_varlen(int v) { return stb_size_varlenu(stb__varlen_xform(v)); }
5809int stb_size_varlenu(unsigned int v)
5810{
5811 if (v < 0x00000080) return 1;
5812 if (v < 0x00004000) return 2;
5813 if (v < 0x00200000) return 3;
5814 if (v < 0x10000000) return 4;
5815 return 5;
5816}
5817
5818void stb_fput_varlen(FILE *f, int v) { stb_fput_varlenu(f, stb__varlen_xform(v)); }
5819
5820void stb_fput_varlenu(FILE *f, unsigned int z)
5821{
5822 if (z >= 0x10000000) fputc(0xF0,f);
5823 if (z >= 0x00200000) fputc((z < 0x10000000 ? 0xE0 : 0)+(z>>24),f);
5824 if (z >= 0x00004000) fputc((z < 0x00200000 ? 0xC0 : 0)+(z>>16),f);
5825 if (z >= 0x00000080) fputc((z < 0x00004000 ? 0x80 : 0)+(z>> 8),f);
5826 fputc(z,f);
5827}
5828
5829#define stb_fgetc(f) ((unsigned char) fgetc(f))
5830
5831int stb_fget_varlen(FILE *f)
5832{
5833 unsigned int z = stb_fget_varlenu(f);
5834 return (z & 1) ? ~(z>>1) : (z>>1);
5835}
5836
5837unsigned int stb_fget_varlenu(FILE *f)
5838{
5839 unsigned int z;
5840 unsigned char d;
5841 d = stb_fgetc(f);
5842
5843 if (d >= 0x80) {
5844 if (d >= 0xc0) {
5845 if (d >= 0xe0) {
5846 if (d == 0xf0) z = stb_fgetc(f) << 24;
5847 else z = (d - 0xe0) << 24;
5848 z += stb_fgetc(f) << 16;
5849 }
5850 else
5851 z = (d - 0xc0) << 16;
5852 z += stb_fgetc(f) << 8;
5853 } else
5854 z = (d - 0x80) << 8;
5855 z += stb_fgetc(f);
5856 } else
5857 z = d;
5858 return z;
5859}
5860
5861stb_uint64 stb_fget_varlen64(FILE *f)
5862{
5863 stb_uint64 z;
5864 unsigned char d;
5865 d = stb_fgetc(f);
5866
5867 if (d >= 0x80) {
5868 if (d >= 0xc0) {
5869 if (d >= 0xe0) {
5870 if (d >= 0xf0) {
5871 if (d >= 0xf8) {
5872 if (d >= 0xfc) {
5873 if (d >= 0xfe) {
5874 if (d >= 0xff)
5875 z = (stb_uint64) stb_fgetc(f) << 56;
5876 else
5877 z = (stb_uint64) (d - 0xfe) << 56;
5878 z |= (stb_uint64) stb_fgetc(f) << 48;
5879 } else z = (stb_uint64) (d - 0xfc) << 48;
5880 z |= (stb_uint64) stb_fgetc(f) << 40;
5881 } else z = (stb_uint64) (d - 0xf8) << 40;
5882 z |= (stb_uint64) stb_fgetc(f) << 32;
5883 } else z = (stb_uint64) (d - 0xf0) << 32;
5884 z |= (stb_uint) stb_fgetc(f) << 24;
5885 } else z = (stb_uint) (d - 0xe0) << 24;
5886 z |= (stb_uint) stb_fgetc(f) << 16;
5887 } else z = (stb_uint) (d - 0xc0) << 16;
5888 z |= (stb_uint) stb_fgetc(f) << 8;
5889 } else z = (stb_uint) (d - 0x80) << 8;
5890 z |= stb_fgetc(f);
5891 } else
5892 z = d;
5893
5894 return (z & 1) ? ~(z >> 1) : (z >> 1);
5895}
5896
5897int stb_size_varlen64(stb_uint64 v)
5898{
5899 if (v < 0x00000080) return 1;
5900 if (v < 0x00004000) return 2;
5901 if (v < 0x00200000) return 3;
5902 if (v < 0x10000000) return 4;
5903 if (v < STB_IMM_UINT64(0x0000000800000000)) return 5;
5904 if (v < STB_IMM_UINT64(0x0000040000000000)) return 6;
5905 if (v < STB_IMM_UINT64(0x0002000000000000)) return 7;
5906 if (v < STB_IMM_UINT64(0x0100000000000000)) return 8;
5907 return 9;
5908}
5909
5910void stb_fput_varlen64(FILE *f, stb_uint64 v)
5911{
5912 stb_uint64 z = stb__varlen_xform(v);
5913 int first=1;
5914 if (z >= STB_IMM_UINT64(0x100000000000000)) {
5915 fputc(0xff,f);
5916 first=0;
5917 }
5918 if (z >= STB_IMM_UINT64(0x02000000000000)) fputc((first ? 0xFE : 0)+(char)(z>>56),f), first=0;
5919 if (z >= STB_IMM_UINT64(0x00040000000000)) fputc((first ? 0xFC : 0)+(char)(z>>48),f), first=0;
5920 if (z >= STB_IMM_UINT64(0x00000800000000)) fputc((first ? 0xF8 : 0)+(char)(z>>40),f), first=0;
5921 if (z >= STB_IMM_UINT64(0x00000010000000)) fputc((first ? 0xF0 : 0)+(char)(z>>32),f), first=0;
5922 if (z >= STB_IMM_UINT64(0x00000000200000)) fputc((first ? 0xE0 : 0)+(char)(z>>24),f), first=0;
5923 if (z >= STB_IMM_UINT64(0x00000000004000)) fputc((first ? 0xC0 : 0)+(char)(z>>16),f), first=0;
5924 if (z >= STB_IMM_UINT64(0x00000000000080)) fputc((first ? 0x80 : 0)+(char)(z>> 8),f), first=0;
5925 fputc((char)z,f);
5926}
5927
5928void stb_fput_ranged(FILE *f, int v, int b, stb_uint n)
5929{
5930 v -= b;
5931 if (n <= (1 << 31))
5932 assert((stb_uint) v < n);
5933 if (n > (1 << 24)) fputc(v >> 24, f);
5934 if (n > (1 << 16)) fputc(v >> 16, f);
5935 if (n > (1 << 8)) fputc(v >> 8, f);
5936 fputc(v,f);
5937}
5938
5939int stb_fget_ranged(FILE *f, int b, stb_uint n)
5940{
5941 unsigned int v=0;
5942 if (n > (1 << 24)) v += stb_fgetc(f) << 24;
5943 if (n > (1 << 16)) v += stb_fgetc(f) << 16;
5944 if (n > (1 << 8)) v += stb_fgetc(f) << 8;
5945 v += stb_fgetc(f);
5946 return b+v;
5947}
5948
5949int stb_size_ranged(int b, stb_uint n)
5950{
5951 if (n > (1 << 24)) return 4;
5952 if (n > (1 << 16)) return 3;
5953 if (n > (1 << 8)) return 2;
5954 return 1;
5955}
5956
5957void stb_fput_string(FILE *f, char *s)
5958{
5959 size_t len = strlen(s);
5960 stb_fput_varlenu(f, (unsigned int) len);
5961 fwrite(s, 1, len, f);
5962}
5963
5964// inverse of the above algorithm
5965char *stb_fget_string(FILE *f, void *p)
5966{
5967 char *s;
5968 int len = stb_fget_varlenu(f);
5969 if (len > 4096) return NULL;
5970 s = p ? stb_malloc_string(p, len+1) : (char *) malloc(len+1);
5971 fread(s, 1, len, f);
5972 s[len] = 0;
5973 return s;
5974}
5975
5976char *stb_strdup(char *str, void *pool)
5977{
5978 size_t len = strlen(str);
5979 char *p = stb_malloc_string(pool, len+1);
5980 stb_p_strcpy_s(p, len+1, str);
5981 return p;
5982}
5983
5984// strip the trailing '/' or '\\' from a directory so we can refer to it
5985// as a file for _stat()
5986char *stb_strip_final_slash(char *t)
5987{
5988 if (t[0]) {
5989 char *z = t + strlen(t) - 1;
5990 // *z is the last character
5991 if (*z == '\\' || *z == '/')
5992 if (z != t+2 || t[1] != ':') // but don't strip it if it's e.g. "c:/"
5993 *z = 0;
5994 if (*z == '\\')
5995 *z = '/'; // canonicalize to make sure it matches db
5996 }
5997 return t;
5998}
5999
6000char *stb_strip_final_slash_regardless(char *t)
6001{
6002 if (t[0]) {
6003 char *z = t + strlen(t) - 1;
6004 // *z is the last character
6005 if (*z == '\\' || *z == '/')
6006 *z = 0;
6007 if (*z == '\\')
6008 *z = '/'; // canonicalize to make sure it matches db
6009 }
6010 return t;
6011}
6012#endif
6013
6015//
6016// Options parsing
6017//
6018
6019STB_EXTERN char **stb_getopt_param(int *argc, char **argv, char *param);
6020STB_EXTERN char **stb_getopt(int *argc, char **argv);
6021STB_EXTERN void stb_getopt_free(char **opts);
6022
6023#ifdef STB_DEFINE
6024
6025void stb_getopt_free(char **opts)
6026{
6027 int i;
6028 char ** o2 = opts;
6029 for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(o2); ++i)
6030 free(o2[i]);
6031 stb_arr_free(o2);
6032}
6033
6034char **stb_getopt(int *argc, char **argv)
6035{
6036 return stb_getopt_param(argc, argv, (char*) "");
6037}
6038
6039char **stb_getopt_param(int *argc, char **argv, char *param)
6040{
6041 char ** opts=NULL;
6042 int i,j=1;
6043 for (i=1; i < *argc; ++i) {
6044 if (argv[i][0] != '-') {
6045 argv[j++] = argv[i];
6046 } else {
6047 if (argv[i][1] == 0) { // plain - == don't parse further options
6048 ++i;
6049 while (i < *argc)
6050 argv[j++] = argv[i++];
6051 break;
6052 } else if (argv[i][1] == '-') {
6053 // copy argument through including initial '-' for clarity
6054 stb_arr_push(opts, stb_p_strdup(argv[i]));
6055 } else {
6056 int k;
6057 char *q = argv[i]; // traverse options list
6058 for (k=1; q[k]; ++k) {
6059 char *s;
6060 if (strchr(param, q[k])) { // does it take a parameter?
6061 char *t = &q[k+1], z = q[k];
6062 size_t len=0;
6063 if (*t == 0) {
6064 if (i == *argc-1) { // takes a parameter, but none found
6065 *argc = 0;
6066 stb_getopt_free(opts);
6067 return NULL;
6068 }
6069 t = argv[++i];
6070 } else
6071 k += (int) strlen(t);
6072 len = strlen(t);
6073 s = (char *) malloc(len+2);
6074 if (!s) return NULL;
6075 s[0] = z;
6076 stb_p_strcpy_s(s+1, len+2, t);
6077 } else {
6078 // no parameter
6079 s = (char *) malloc(2);
6080 if (!s) return NULL;
6081 s[0] = q[k];
6082 s[1] = 0;
6083 }
6084 stb_arr_push(opts, s);
6085 }
6086 }
6087 }
6088 }
6089 stb_arr_push(opts, NULL);
6090 *argc = j;
6091 return opts;
6092}
6093#endif
6094
6095
6097//
6098// Portable directory reading
6099//
6100
6101STB_EXTERN char **stb_readdir_files (char *dir);
6102STB_EXTERN char **stb_readdir_files_mask(char *dir, char *wild);
6103STB_EXTERN char **stb_readdir_subdirs(char *dir);
6104STB_EXTERN char **stb_readdir_subdirs_mask(char *dir, char *wild);
6105STB_EXTERN void stb_readdir_free (char **files);
6106STB_EXTERN char **stb_readdir_recursive(char *dir, char *filespec);
6107STB_EXTERN void stb_delete_directory_recursive(char *dir);
6108
6109#ifdef STB_DEFINE
6110
6111#ifdef _MSC_VER
6112#include <io.h>
6113#else
6114#include <unistd.h>
6115#include <dirent.h>
6116#endif
6117
6118void stb_readdir_free(char **files)
6119{
6120 char **f2 = files;
6121 int i;
6122 for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(f2); ++i)
6123 free(f2[i]);
6124 stb_arr_free(f2);
6125}
6126
6127static int isdotdirname(char *name)
6128{
6129 if (name[0] == '.')
6130 return (name[1] == '.') ? !name[2] : !name[1];
6131 return 0;
6132}
6133
6134STB_EXTERN int stb_wildmatchi(char *expr, char *candidate);
6135static char **readdir_raw(char *dir, int return_subdirs, char *mask)
6136{
6137 char **results = NULL;
6138 char buffer[4096], with_slash[4096];
6139 size_t n;
6140
6141 #ifdef WIN32
6142 stb__wchar *ws;
6143 struct _wfinddata_t data;
6144 #ifdef _WIN64
6145 const intptr_t none = -1;
6146 intptr_t z;
6147 #else
6148 const long none = -1;
6149 long z;
6150 #endif
6151 #else // !WIN32
6152 const DIR *none = NULL;
6153 DIR *z;
6154 #endif
6155
6156 n = stb_strscpy(buffer,dir,sizeof(buffer));
6157 if (!n || n >= sizeof(buffer))
6158 return NULL;
6159 stb_fixpath(buffer);
6160
6161 if (n > 0 && (buffer[n-1] != '/')) {
6162 buffer[n++] = '/';
6163 }
6164 buffer[n] = 0;
6165 if (!stb_strscpy(with_slash,buffer,sizeof(with_slash)))
6166 return NULL;
6167
6168 #ifdef WIN32
6169 if (!stb_strscpy(buffer+n,"*.*",sizeof(buffer)-n))
6170 return NULL;
6171 ws = stb__from_utf8(buffer);
6172 z = _wfindfirst((wchar_t *)ws, &data);
6173 #else
6174 z = opendir(dir);
6175 #endif
6176
6177 if (z != none) {
6178 int nonempty = STB_TRUE;
6179 #ifndef WIN32
6180 struct dirent *data = readdir(z);
6181 nonempty = (data != NULL);
6182 #endif
6183
6184 if (nonempty) {
6185
6186 do {
6187 int is_subdir;
6188 #ifdef WIN32
6189 char *name = stb__to_utf8((stb__wchar *)data.name);
6190 if (name == NULL) {
6191 fprintf(stderr, "%s to convert '%S' to %s!\n", "Unable", data.name, "utf8");
6192 continue;
6193 }
6194 is_subdir = !!(data.attrib & _A_SUBDIR);
6195 #else
6196 char *name = data->d_name;
6197 if (!stb_strscpy(buffer+n,name,sizeof(buffer)-n))
6198 break;
6199 // Could follow DT_LNK, but would need to check for recursive links.
6200 is_subdir = !!(data->d_type & DT_DIR);
6201 #endif
6202
6203 if (is_subdir == return_subdirs) {
6204 if (!is_subdir || !isdotdirname(name)) {
6205 if (!mask || stb_wildmatchi(mask, name)) {
6206 char buffer[4096],*p=buffer;
6207 if ( stb_snprintf(buffer, sizeof(buffer), "%s%s", with_slash, name) < 0 )
6208 break;
6209 if (buffer[0] == '.' && buffer[1] == '/')
6210 p = buffer+2;
6211 stb_arr_push(results, stb_p_strdup(p));
6212 }
6213 }
6214 }
6215 }
6216 #ifdef WIN32
6217 while (0 == _wfindnext(z, &data));
6218 #else
6219 while ((data = readdir(z)) != NULL);
6220 #endif
6221 }
6222 #ifdef WIN32
6223 _findclose(z);
6224 #else
6225 closedir(z);
6226 #endif
6227 }
6228 return results;
6229}
6230
6231char **stb_readdir_files (char *dir) { return readdir_raw(dir, 0, NULL); }
6232char **stb_readdir_subdirs(char *dir) { return readdir_raw(dir, 1, NULL); }
6233char **stb_readdir_files_mask(char *dir, char *wild) { return readdir_raw(dir, 0, wild); }
6234char **stb_readdir_subdirs_mask(char *dir, char *wild) { return readdir_raw(dir, 1, wild); }
6235
6236int stb__rec_max=0x7fffffff;
6237static char **stb_readdir_rec(char **sofar, char *dir, char *filespec)
6238{
6239 char **files;
6240 char ** dirs;
6241 char **p;
6242
6243 if (stb_arr_len(sofar) >= stb__rec_max) return sofar;
6244
6245 files = stb_readdir_files_mask(dir, filespec);
6246 stb_arr_for(p, files) {
6247 stb_arr_push(sofar, stb_p_strdup(*p));
6248 if (stb_arr_len(sofar) >= stb__rec_max) break;
6249 }
6250 stb_readdir_free(files);
6251 if (stb_arr_len(sofar) >= stb__rec_max) return sofar;
6252
6253 dirs = stb_readdir_subdirs(dir);
6254 stb_arr_for(p, dirs)
6255 sofar = stb_readdir_rec(sofar, *p, filespec);
6256 stb_readdir_free(dirs);
6257 return sofar;
6258}
6259
6260char **stb_readdir_recursive(char *dir, char *filespec)
6261{
6262 return stb_readdir_rec(NULL, dir, filespec);
6263}
6264
6265void stb_delete_directory_recursive(char *dir)
6266{
6267 char **list = stb_readdir_subdirs(dir);
6268 int i;
6269 for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(list); ++i)
6270 stb_delete_directory_recursive(list[i]);
6271 stb_arr_free(list);
6272 list = stb_readdir_files(dir);
6273 for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(list); ++i)
6274 if (!remove(list[i])) {
6275 // on windows, try again after making it writeable; don't ALWAYS
6276 // do this first since that would be slow in the normal case
6277 #ifdef _MSC_VER
6278 _chmod(list[i], _S_IWRITE);
6279 remove(list[i]);
6280 #endif
6281 }
6282 stb_arr_free(list);
6283 stb__windows(_rmdir,rmdir)(dir);
6284}
6285
6286#endif
6287
6289//
6290// construct trees from filenames; useful for cmirror summaries
6291
6292typedef struct stb_dirtree2 stb_dirtree2;
6293
6294struct stb_dirtree2
6295{
6296 stb_dirtree2 **subdirs;
6297
6298 // make convenient for stb_summarize_tree
6299 int num_subdir;
6300 float weight;
6301
6302 // actual data
6303 char *fullpath;
6304 char *relpath;
6305 char **files;
6306};
6307
6308STB_EXTERN stb_dirtree2 *stb_dirtree2_from_files_relative(char *src, char **filelist, int count);
6309STB_EXTERN stb_dirtree2 *stb_dirtree2_from_files(char **filelist, int count);
6310STB_EXTERN int stb_dir_is_prefix(char *dir, int dirlen, char *file);
6311
6312#ifdef STB_DEFINE
6313
6314int stb_dir_is_prefix(char *dir, int dirlen, char *file)
6315{
6316 if (dirlen == 0) return STB_TRUE;
6317 if (stb_strnicmp(dir, file, dirlen)) return STB_FALSE;
6318 if (file[dirlen] == '/' || file[dirlen] == '\\') return STB_TRUE;
6319 return STB_FALSE;
6320}
6321
6322stb_dirtree2 *stb_dirtree2_from_files_relative(char *src, char **filelist, int count)
6323{
6324 char buffer1[1024];
6325 int i;
6326 int dlen = (int) strlen(src), elen;
6327 stb_dirtree2 *d;
6328 char ** descendents = NULL;
6329 char ** files = NULL;
6330 char *s;
6331 if (!count) return NULL;
6332 // first find all the ones that belong here... note this is will take O(NM) with N files and M subdirs
6333 for (i=0; i < count; ++i) {
6334 if (stb_dir_is_prefix(src, dlen, filelist[i])) {
6335 stb_arr_push(descendents, filelist[i]);
6336 }
6337 }
6338 if (descendents == NULL)
6339 return NULL;
6340 elen = dlen;
6341 // skip a leading slash
6342 if (elen == 0 && (descendents[0][0] == '/' || descendents[0][0] == '\\'))
6343 ++elen;
6344 else if (elen)
6345 ++elen;
6346 // now extract all the ones that have their root here
6347 for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(descendents);) {
6348 if (!stb_strchr2(descendents[i]+elen, '/', '\\')) {
6349 stb_arr_push(files, descendents[i]);
6350 descendents[i] = descendents[stb_arr_len(descendents)-1];
6351 stb_arr_pop(descendents);
6352 } else
6353 ++i;
6354 }
6355 // now create a record
6356 d = (stb_dirtree2 *) malloc(sizeof(*d));
6357 d->files = files;
6358 d->subdirs = NULL;
6359 d->fullpath = stb_p_strdup(src);
6360 s = stb_strrchr2(d->fullpath, '/', '\\');
6361 if (s)
6362 ++s;
6363 else
6364 s = d->fullpath;
6365 d->relpath = s;
6366 // now create the children
6367 qsort(descendents, stb_arr_len(descendents), sizeof(char *), stb_qsort_stricmp(0));
6368 buffer1[0] = 0;
6369 for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(descendents); ++i) {
6370 char buffer2[1024];
6371 char *s = descendents[i] + elen, *t;
6372 t = stb_strchr2(s, '/', '\\');
6373 assert(t);
6374 stb_strncpy(buffer2, descendents[i], (int) (t-descendents[i]+1));
6375 if (stb_stricmp(buffer1, buffer2)) {
6376 stb_dirtree2 *t = stb_dirtree2_from_files_relative(buffer2, descendents, stb_arr_len(descendents));
6377 assert(t != NULL);
6378 stb_p_strcpy_s(buffer1, sizeof(buffer1), buffer2);
6379 stb_arr_push(d->subdirs, t);
6380 }
6381 }
6382 d->num_subdir = stb_arr_len(d->subdirs);
6383 d->weight = 0;
6384 return d;
6385}
6386
6387stb_dirtree2 *stb_dirtree2_from_files(char **filelist, int count)
6388{
6389 return stb_dirtree2_from_files_relative((char*) "", filelist, count);
6390}
6391#endif
6392
6394//
6395// Checksums: CRC-32, ADLER32, SHA-1
6396//
6397// CRC-32 and ADLER32 allow streaming blocks
6398// SHA-1 requires either a complete buffer, max size 2^32 - 73
6399// or it can checksum directly from a file, max 2^61
6400
6401#define STB_ADLER32_SEED 1
6402#define STB_CRC32_SEED 0 // note that we logical NOT this in the code
6403
6404STB_EXTERN stb_uint
6405 stb_adler32(stb_uint adler32, stb_uchar *buffer, stb_uint buflen);
6406STB_EXTERN stb_uint
6407 stb_crc32_block(stb_uint crc32, stb_uchar *buffer, stb_uint len);
6408STB_EXTERN stb_uint stb_crc32(unsigned char *buffer, stb_uint len);
6409
6410STB_EXTERN void stb_sha1(
6411 unsigned char output[20], unsigned char *buffer, unsigned int len);
6412STB_EXTERN int stb_sha1_file(unsigned char output[20], char *file);
6413
6414STB_EXTERN void stb_sha1_readable(char display[27], unsigned char sha[20]);
6415
6416#ifdef STB_DEFINE
6417stb_uint stb_crc32_block(stb_uint crc, unsigned char *buffer, stb_uint len)
6418{
6419 static stb_uint crc_table[256];
6420 stb_uint i,j,s;
6421 crc = ~crc;
6422
6423 if (crc_table[1] == 0)
6424 for(i=0; i < 256; i++) {
6425 for (s=i, j=0; j < 8; ++j)
6426 s = (s >> 1) ^ (s & 1 ? 0xedb88320 : 0);
6427 crc_table[i] = s;
6428 }
6429 for (i=0; i < len; ++i)
6430 crc = (crc >> 8) ^ crc_table[buffer[i] ^ (crc & 0xff)];
6431 return ~crc;
6432}
6433
6434stb_uint stb_crc32(unsigned char *buffer, stb_uint len)
6435{
6436 return stb_crc32_block(0, buffer, len);
6437}
6438
6439stb_uint stb_adler32(stb_uint adler32, stb_uchar *buffer, stb_uint buflen)
6440{
6441 const unsigned long ADLER_MOD = 65521;
6442 unsigned long s1 = adler32 & 0xffff, s2 = adler32 >> 16;
6443 unsigned long blocklen, i;
6444
6445 blocklen = buflen % 5552;
6446 while (buflen) {
6447 for (i=0; i + 7 < blocklen; i += 8) {
6448 s1 += buffer[0], s2 += s1;
6449 s1 += buffer[1], s2 += s1;
6450 s1 += buffer[2], s2 += s1;
6451 s1 += buffer[3], s2 += s1;
6452 s1 += buffer[4], s2 += s1;
6453 s1 += buffer[5], s2 += s1;
6454 s1 += buffer[6], s2 += s1;
6455 s1 += buffer[7], s2 += s1;
6456
6457 buffer += 8;
6458 }
6459
6460 for (; i < blocklen; ++i)
6461 s1 += *buffer++, s2 += s1;
6462
6463 s1 %= ADLER_MOD, s2 %= ADLER_MOD;
6464 buflen -= blocklen;
6465 blocklen = 5552;
6466 }
6467 return (s2 << 16) + s1;
6468}
6469
6470static void stb__sha1(stb_uchar *chunk, stb_uint h[5])
6471{
6472 int i;
6473 stb_uint a,b,c,d,e;
6474 stb_uint w[80];
6475
6476 for (i=0; i < 16; ++i)
6477 w[i] = stb_big32(&chunk[i*4]);
6478 for (i=16; i < 80; ++i) {
6479 stb_uint t;
6480 t = w[i-3] ^ w[i-8] ^ w[i-14] ^ w[i-16];
6481 w[i] = (t + t) | (t >> 31);
6482 }
6483
6484 a = h[0];
6485 b = h[1];
6486 c = h[2];
6487 d = h[3];
6488 e = h[4];
6489
6490 #define STB__SHA1(k,f) \
6491 { \
6492 stb_uint temp = (a << 5) + (a >> 27) + (f) + e + (k) + w[i]; \
6493 e = d; \
6494 d = c; \
6495 c = (b << 30) + (b >> 2); \
6496 b = a; \
6497 a = temp; \
6498 }
6499
6500 i=0;
6501 for (; i < 20; ++i) STB__SHA1(0x5a827999, d ^ (b & (c ^ d)) );
6502 for (; i < 40; ++i) STB__SHA1(0x6ed9eba1, b ^ c ^ d );
6503 for (; i < 60; ++i) STB__SHA1(0x8f1bbcdc, (b & c) + (d & (b ^ c)) );
6504 for (; i < 80; ++i) STB__SHA1(0xca62c1d6, b ^ c ^ d );
6505
6506 #undef STB__SHA1
6507
6508 h[0] += a;
6509 h[1] += b;
6510 h[2] += c;
6511 h[3] += d;
6512 h[4] += e;
6513}
6514
6515void stb_sha1(stb_uchar output[20], stb_uchar *buffer, stb_uint len)
6516{
6517 unsigned char final_block[128];
6518 stb_uint end_start, final_len, j;
6519 int i;
6520
6521 stb_uint h[5];
6522
6523 h[0] = 0x67452301;
6524 h[1] = 0xefcdab89;
6525 h[2] = 0x98badcfe;
6526 h[3] = 0x10325476;
6527 h[4] = 0xc3d2e1f0;
6528
6529 // we need to write padding to the last one or two
6530 // blocks, so build those first into 'final_block'
6531
6532 // we have to write one special byte, plus the 8-byte length
6533
6534 // compute the block where the data runs out
6535 end_start = len & ~63;
6536
6537 // compute the earliest we can encode the length
6538 if (((len+9) & ~63) == end_start) {
6539 // it all fits in one block, so fill a second-to-last block
6540 end_start -= 64;
6541 }
6542
6543 final_len = end_start + 128;
6544
6545 // now we need to copy the data in
6546 assert(end_start + 128 >= len+9);
6547 assert(end_start < len || len < 64-9);
6548
6549 j = 0;
6550 if (end_start > len)
6551 j = (stb_uint) - (int) end_start;
6552
6553 for (; end_start + j < len; ++j)
6554 final_block[j] = buffer[end_start + j];
6555 final_block[j++] = 0x80;
6556 while (j < 128-5) // 5 byte length, so write 4 extra padding bytes
6557 final_block[j++] = 0;
6558 // big-endian size
6559 final_block[j++] = len >> 29;
6560 final_block[j++] = len >> 21;
6561 final_block[j++] = len >> 13;
6562 final_block[j++] = len >> 5;
6563 final_block[j++] = len << 3;
6564 assert(j == 128 && end_start + j == final_len);
6565
6566 for (j=0; j < final_len; j += 64) { // 512-bit chunks
6567 if (j+64 >= end_start+64)
6568 stb__sha1(&final_block[j - end_start], h);
6569 else
6570 stb__sha1(&buffer[j], h);
6571 }
6572
6573 for (i=0; i < 5; ++i) {
6574 output[i*4 + 0] = h[i] >> 24;
6575 output[i*4 + 1] = h[i] >> 16;
6576 output[i*4 + 2] = h[i] >> 8;
6577 output[i*4 + 3] = h[i] >> 0;
6578 }
6579}
6580
6581#ifdef _MSC_VER
6582int stb_sha1_file(stb_uchar output[20], char *file)
6583{
6584 int i;
6585 stb_uint64 length=0;
6586 unsigned char buffer[128];
6587
6588 FILE *f = stb__fopen(file, "rb");
6589 stb_uint h[5];
6590
6591 if (f == NULL) return 0; // file not found
6592
6593 h[0] = 0x67452301;
6594 h[1] = 0xefcdab89;
6595 h[2] = 0x98badcfe;
6596 h[3] = 0x10325476;
6597 h[4] = 0xc3d2e1f0;
6598
6599 for(;;) {
6600 size_t n = fread(buffer, 1, 64, f);
6601 if (n == 64) {
6602 stb__sha1(buffer, h);
6603 length += n;
6604 } else {
6605 int block = 64;
6606
6607 length += n;
6608
6609 buffer[n++] = 0x80;
6610
6611 // if there isn't enough room for the length, double the block
6612 if (n + 8 > 64)
6613 block = 128;
6614
6615 // pad to end
6616 memset(buffer+n, 0, block-8-n);
6617
6618 i = block - 8;
6619 buffer[i++] = (stb_uchar) (length >> 53);
6620 buffer[i++] = (stb_uchar) (length >> 45);
6621 buffer[i++] = (stb_uchar) (length >> 37);
6622 buffer[i++] = (stb_uchar) (length >> 29);
6623 buffer[i++] = (stb_uchar) (length >> 21);
6624 buffer[i++] = (stb_uchar) (length >> 13);
6625 buffer[i++] = (stb_uchar) (length >> 5);
6626 buffer[i++] = (stb_uchar) (length << 3);
6627 assert(i == block);
6628 stb__sha1(buffer, h);
6629 if (block == 128)
6630 stb__sha1(buffer+64, h);
6631 else
6632 assert(block == 64);
6633 break;
6634 }
6635 }
6636 fclose(f);
6637
6638 for (i=0; i < 5; ++i) {
6639 output[i*4 + 0] = h[i] >> 24;
6640 output[i*4 + 1] = h[i] >> 16;
6641 output[i*4 + 2] = h[i] >> 8;
6642 output[i*4 + 3] = h[i] >> 0;
6643 }
6644
6645 return 1;
6646}
6647#endif // _MSC_VER
6648
6649// client can truncate this wherever they like
6650void stb_sha1_readable(char display[27], unsigned char sha[20])
6651{
6652 char encoding[65] = "0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuv"
6653 "wxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ%$";
6654 int num_bits = 0, acc=0;
6655 int i=0,o=0;
6656 while (o < 26) {
6657 int v;
6658 // expand the accumulator
6659 if (num_bits < 6) {
6660 assert(i != 20);
6661 acc += sha[i++] << num_bits;
6662 num_bits += 8;
6663 }
6664 v = acc & ((1 << 6) - 1);
6665 display[o++] = encoding[v];
6666 acc >>= 6;
6667 num_bits -= 6;
6668 }
6669 assert(num_bits == 20*8 - 26*6);
6670 display[o++] = encoding[acc];
6671}
6672
6673#endif // STB_DEFINE
6674
6676//
6677// simplified WINDOWS registry interface... hopefully
6678// we'll never actually use this?
6679
6680#if defined(_WIN32)
6681
6682STB_EXTERN void * stb_reg_open(const char *mode, const char *where); // mode: "rHKLM" or "rHKCU" or "w.."
6683STB_EXTERN void stb_reg_close(void *reg);
6684STB_EXTERN int stb_reg_read(void *zreg, const char *str, void *data, unsigned long len);
6685STB_EXTERN int stb_reg_read_string(void *zreg, const char *str, char *data, int len);
6686STB_EXTERN void stb_reg_write(void *zreg, const char *str, const void *data, unsigned long len);
6687STB_EXTERN void stb_reg_write_string(void *zreg, const char *str, const char *data);
6688
6689#if defined(STB_DEFINE) && !defined(STB_NO_REGISTRY)
6690
6691#define STB_HAS_REGISTRY
6692
6693#ifndef _WINDOWS_
6694
6695#define HKEY void *
6696
6697STB_EXTERN __declspec(dllimport) long __stdcall RegCloseKey ( HKEY hKey );
6698STB_EXTERN __declspec(dllimport) long __stdcall RegCreateKeyExA ( HKEY hKey, const char * lpSubKey,
6699 int Reserved, char * lpClass, int dwOptions,
6700 int samDesired, void *lpSecurityAttributes, HKEY * phkResult, int * lpdwDisposition );
6701STB_EXTERN __declspec(dllimport) long __stdcall RegDeleteKeyA ( HKEY hKey, const char * lpSubKey );
6702STB_EXTERN __declspec(dllimport) long __stdcall RegQueryValueExA ( HKEY hKey, const char * lpValueName,
6703 int * lpReserved, unsigned long * lpType, unsigned char * lpData, unsigned long * lpcbData );
6704STB_EXTERN __declspec(dllimport) long __stdcall RegSetValueExA ( HKEY hKey, const char * lpValueName,
6705 int Reserved, int dwType, const unsigned char* lpData, int cbData );
6706STB_EXTERN __declspec(dllimport) long __stdcall RegOpenKeyExA ( HKEY hKey, const char * lpSubKey,
6707 int ulOptions, int samDesired, HKEY * phkResult );
6708
6709#endif // _WINDOWS_
6710
6711#define STB__REG_OPTION_NON_VOLATILE 0
6712#define STB__REG_KEY_ALL_ACCESS 0x000f003f
6713#define STB__REG_KEY_READ 0x00020019
6714
6715#ifdef _M_AMD64
6716#define STB__HKEY_CURRENT_USER 0x80000001ull
6717#define STB__HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE 0x80000002ull
6718#else
6719#define STB__HKEY_CURRENT_USER 0x80000001
6720#define STB__HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE 0x80000002
6721#endif
6722
6723void *stb_reg_open(const char *mode, const char *where)
6724{
6725 long res;
6726 HKEY base;
6727 HKEY zreg;
6728 if (!stb_stricmp(mode+1, "cu") || !stb_stricmp(mode+1, "hkcu"))
6729 base = (HKEY) STB__HKEY_CURRENT_USER;
6730 else if (!stb_stricmp(mode+1, "lm") || !stb_stricmp(mode+1, "hklm"))
6731 base = (HKEY) STB__HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE;
6732 else
6733 return NULL;
6734
6735 if (mode[0] == 'r')
6736 res = RegOpenKeyExA(base, where, 0, STB__REG_KEY_READ, &zreg);
6737 else if (mode[0] == 'w')
6738 res = RegCreateKeyExA(base, where, 0, NULL, STB__REG_OPTION_NON_VOLATILE, STB__REG_KEY_ALL_ACCESS, NULL, &zreg, NULL);
6739 else
6740 return NULL;
6741
6742 return res ? NULL : zreg;
6743}
6744
6745void stb_reg_close(void *reg)
6746{
6747 RegCloseKey((HKEY) reg);
6748}
6749
6750#define STB__REG_SZ 1
6751#define STB__REG_BINARY 3
6752#define STB__REG_DWORD 4
6753
6754int stb_reg_read(void *zreg, const char *str, void *data, unsigned long len)
6755{
6756 unsigned long type;
6757 unsigned long alen = len;
6758 if (0 == RegQueryValueExA((HKEY) zreg, str, 0, &type, (unsigned char *) data, &len))
6759 if (type == STB__REG_BINARY || type == STB__REG_SZ || type == STB__REG_DWORD) {
6760 if (len < alen)
6761 *((char *) data + len) = 0;
6762 return 1;
6763 }
6764 return 0;
6765}
6766
6767void stb_reg_write(void *zreg, const char *str, const void *data, unsigned long len)
6768{
6769 if (zreg)
6770 RegSetValueExA((HKEY) zreg, str, 0, STB__REG_BINARY, (const unsigned char *) data, len);
6771}
6772
6773int stb_reg_read_string(void *zreg, const char *str, char *data, int len)
6774{
6775 if (!stb_reg_read(zreg, str, data, len)) return 0;
6776 data[len-1] = 0; // force a 0 at the end of the string no matter what
6777 return 1;
6778}
6779
6780void stb_reg_write_string(void *zreg, const char *str, const char *data)
6781{
6782 if (zreg)
6783 RegSetValueExA((HKEY) zreg, str, 0, STB__REG_SZ, (const unsigned char *) data, (int) strlen(data)+1);
6784}
6785#endif // STB_DEFINE
6786#endif // _WIN32
6787
6788
6790//
6791// stb_cfg - This is like the registry, but the config info
6792// is all stored in plain old files where we can
6793// backup and restore them easily. The LOCATION of
6794// the config files is gotten from... the registry!
6795
6796#ifndef STB_NO_STB_STRINGS
6797typedef struct stb_cfg_st stb_cfg;
6798
6799STB_EXTERN stb_cfg * stb_cfg_open(char *config, const char *mode); // mode = "r", "w"
6800STB_EXTERN void stb_cfg_close(stb_cfg *cfg);
6801STB_EXTERN int stb_cfg_read(stb_cfg *cfg, char *key, void *value, int len);
6802STB_EXTERN void stb_cfg_write(stb_cfg *cfg, char *key, void *value, int len);
6803STB_EXTERN int stb_cfg_read_string(stb_cfg *cfg, char *key, char *value, int len);
6804STB_EXTERN void stb_cfg_write_string(stb_cfg *cfg, char *key, char *value);
6805STB_EXTERN int stb_cfg_delete(stb_cfg *cfg, char *key);
6806STB_EXTERN void stb_cfg_set_directory(char *dir);
6807
6808#ifdef STB_DEFINE
6809
6810typedef struct
6811{
6812 char *key;
6813 void *value;
6814 int value_len;
6815} stb__cfg_item;
6816
6817struct stb_cfg_st
6818{
6819 stb__cfg_item *data;
6820 char *loaded_file; // this needs to be freed
6821 FILE *f; // write the data to this file on close
6822};
6823
6824static const char *stb__cfg_sig = "sTbCoNfIg!\0\0";
6825static char stb__cfg_dir[512];
6826STB_EXTERN void stb_cfg_set_directory(char *dir)
6827{
6828 stb_p_strcpy_s(stb__cfg_dir, sizeof(stb__cfg_dir), dir);
6829}
6830
6831STB_EXTERN stb_cfg * stb_cfg_open(char *config, const char *mode)
6832{
6833 size_t len;
6834 stb_cfg *z;
6835 char file[512];
6836 if (mode[0] != 'r' && mode[0] != 'w') return NULL;
6837
6838 if (!stb__cfg_dir[0]) {
6839 #ifdef _WIN32
6840 stb_p_strcpy_s(stb__cfg_dir, sizeof(stb__cfg_dir), "c:/stb");
6841 #else
6842 strcpy(stb__cfg_dir, "~/.stbconfig");
6843 #endif
6844
6845 #ifdef STB_HAS_REGISTRY
6846 {
6847 void *reg = stb_reg_open("rHKLM", "Software\\SilverSpaceship\\stb");
6848 if (reg) {
6849 stb_reg_read_string(reg, "config_dir", stb__cfg_dir, sizeof(stb__cfg_dir));
6850 stb_reg_close(reg);
6851 }
6852 }
6853 #endif
6854 }
6855
6856 stb_p_sprintf(file stb_p_size(sizeof(file)), "%s/%s.cfg", stb__cfg_dir, config);
6857
6858 z = (stb_cfg *) stb_malloc(0, sizeof(*z));
6859 z->data = NULL;
6860
6861 z->loaded_file = stb_filec(file, &len);
6862 if (z->loaded_file) {
6863 char *s = z->loaded_file;
6864 if (!memcmp(s, stb__cfg_sig, 12)) {
6865 char *s = z->loaded_file + 12;
6866 while (s < z->loaded_file + len) {
6867 stb__cfg_item a;
6868 int n = *(stb_int16 *) s;
6869 a.key = s+2;
6870 s = s+2 + n;
6871 a.value_len = *(int *) s;
6872 s += 4;
6873 a.value = s;
6874 s += a.value_len;
6875 stb_arr_push(z->data, a);
6876 }
6877 assert(s == z->loaded_file + len);
6878 }
6879 }
6880
6881 if (mode[0] == 'w')
6882 z->f = stb_p_fopen(file, "wb");
6883 else
6884 z->f = NULL;
6885
6886 return z;
6887}
6888
6889void stb_cfg_close(stb_cfg *z)
6890{
6891 if (z->f) {
6892 int i;
6893 // write the file out
6894 fwrite(stb__cfg_sig, 12, 1, z->f);
6895 for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(z->data); ++i) {
6896 stb_int16 n = (stb_int16) strlen(z->data[i].key)+1;
6897 fwrite(&n, 2, 1, z->f);
6898 fwrite(z->data[i].key, n, 1, z->f);
6899 fwrite(&z->data[i].value_len, 4, 1, z->f);
6900 fwrite(z->data[i].value, z->data[i].value_len, 1, z->f);
6901 }
6902 fclose(z->f);
6903 }
6904 stb_arr_free(z->data);
6905 stb_free(z);
6906}
6907
6908int stb_cfg_read(stb_cfg *z, char *key, void *value, int len)
6909{
6910 int i;
6911 for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(z->data); ++i) {
6912 if (!stb_stricmp(z->data[i].key, key)) {
6913 int n = stb_min(len, z->data[i].value_len);
6914 memcpy(value, z->data[i].value, n);
6915 if (n < len)
6916 *((char *) value + n) = 0;
6917 return 1;
6918 }
6919 }
6920 return 0;
6921}
6922
6923void stb_cfg_write(stb_cfg *z, char *key, void *value, int len)
6924{
6925 int i;
6926 for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(z->data); ++i)
6927 if (!stb_stricmp(z->data[i].key, key))
6928 break;
6929 if (i == stb_arr_len(z->data)) {
6930 stb__cfg_item p;
6931 p.key = stb_strdup(key, z);
6932 p.value = NULL;
6933 p.value_len = 0;
6934 stb_arr_push(z->data, p);
6935 }
6936 z->data[i].value = stb_malloc(z, len);
6937 z->data[i].value_len = len;
6938 memcpy(z->data[i].value, value, len);
6939}
6940
6941int stb_cfg_delete(stb_cfg *z, char *key)
6942{
6943 int i;
6944 for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(z->data); ++i)
6945 if (!stb_stricmp(z->data[i].key, key)) {
6946 stb_arr_fastdelete(z->data, i);
6947 return 1;
6948 }
6949 return 0;
6950}
6951
6952int stb_cfg_read_string(stb_cfg *z, char *key, char *value, int len)
6953{
6954 if (!stb_cfg_read(z, key, value, len)) return 0;
6955 value[len-1] = 0;
6956 return 1;
6957}
6958
6959void stb_cfg_write_string(stb_cfg *z, char *key, char *value)
6960{
6961 stb_cfg_write(z, key, value, (int) strlen(value)+1);
6962}
6963#endif
6964
6966//
6967// stb_dirtree - load a description of a directory tree
6968// uses a cache and stat()s the directories for changes
6969// MUCH faster on NTFS, _wrong_ on FAT32, so should
6970// ignore the db on FAT32
6971
6972#ifdef _WIN32
6973
6974typedef struct
6975{
6976 char * path; // full path from passed-in root
6977 time_t last_modified;
6978 int num_files;
6979 int flag;
6980} stb_dirtree_dir;
6981
6982typedef struct
6983{
6984 char *name; // name relative to path
6985 int dir; // index into dirs[] array
6986 stb_int64 size; // size, max 4GB
6987 time_t last_modified;
6988 int flag;
6989} stb_dirtree_file;
6990
6991typedef struct
6992{
6993 stb_dirtree_dir *dirs;
6994 stb_dirtree_file *files;
6995
6996 // internal use
6997 void * string_pool; // used to free data en masse
6998} stb_dirtree;
6999
7000extern void stb_dirtree_free ( stb_dirtree *d );
7001extern stb_dirtree *stb_dirtree_get ( char *dir);
7002extern stb_dirtree *stb_dirtree_get_dir ( char *dir, char *cache_dir);
7003extern stb_dirtree *stb_dirtree_get_with_file ( char *dir, char *cache_file);
7004
7005// get a list of all the files recursively underneath 'dir'
7006//
7007// cache_file is used to store a copy of the directory tree to speed up
7008// later calls. It must be unique to 'dir' and the current working
7009// directory! Otherwise who knows what will happen (a good solution
7010// is to put it _in_ dir, but this API doesn't force that).
7011//
7012// Also, it might be possible to break this if you have two different processes
7013// do a call to stb_dirtree_get() with the same cache file at about the same
7014// time, but I _think_ it might just work.
7015
7016// i needed to build an identical data structure representing the state of
7017// a mirrored copy WITHOUT bothering to rescan it (i.e. we're mirroring to
7018// it WITHOUT scanning it, e.g. it's over the net), so this requires access
7019// to all of the innards.
7020extern void stb_dirtree_db_add_dir(stb_dirtree *active, char *path, time_t last);
7021extern void stb_dirtree_db_add_file(stb_dirtree *active, char *name, int dir, stb_int64 size, time_t last);
7022extern void stb_dirtree_db_read(stb_dirtree *target, char *filename, char *dir);
7023extern void stb_dirtree_db_write(stb_dirtree *target, char *filename, char *dir);
7024
7025#ifdef STB_DEFINE
7026static void stb__dirtree_add_dir(char *path, time_t last, stb_dirtree *active)
7027{
7028 stb_dirtree_dir d;
7029 d.last_modified = last;
7030 d.num_files = 0;
7031 d.path = stb_strdup(path, active->string_pool);
7032 stb_arr_push(active->dirs, d);
7033}
7034
7035static void stb__dirtree_add_file(char *name, int dir, stb_int64 size, time_t last, stb_dirtree *active)
7036{
7037 stb_dirtree_file f;
7038 f.dir = dir;
7039 f.size = size;
7040 f.last_modified = last;
7041 f.name = stb_strdup(name, active->string_pool);
7042 ++active->dirs[dir].num_files;
7043 stb_arr_push(active->files, f);
7044}
7045
7046// version 02 supports > 4GB files
7047static char stb__signature[12] = { 's', 'T', 'b', 'D', 'i', 'R', 't', 'R', 'e', 'E', '0', '2' };
7048
7049static void stb__dirtree_save_db(char *filename, stb_dirtree *data, char *root)
7050{
7051 int i, num_dirs_final=0, num_files_final;
7052 char *info = root ? root : (char*)"";
7053 int *remap;
7054 FILE *f = stb_p_fopen(filename, "wb");
7055 if (!f) return;
7056
7057 fwrite(stb__signature, sizeof(stb__signature), 1, f);
7058 fwrite(info, strlen(info)+1, 1, f);
7059 // need to be slightly tricky and not write out NULLed directories, nor the root
7060
7061 // build remapping table of all dirs we'll be writing out
7062 remap = (int *) malloc(sizeof(remap[0]) * stb_arr_len(data->dirs));
7063 for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(data->dirs); ++i) {
7064 if (data->dirs[i].path == NULL || (root && 0==stb_stricmp(data->dirs[i].path, root))) {
7065 remap[i] = -1;
7066 } else {
7067 remap[i] = num_dirs_final++;
7068 }
7069 }
7070
7071 fwrite(&num_dirs_final, 4, 1, f);
7072 for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(data->dirs); ++i) {
7073 if (remap[i] >= 0) {
7074 fwrite(&data->dirs[i].last_modified, 4, 1, f);
7075 stb_fput_string(f, data->dirs[i].path);
7076 }
7077 }
7078
7079 num_files_final = 0;
7080 for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(data->files); ++i)
7081 if (remap[data->files[i].dir] >= 0 && data->files[i].name)
7082 ++num_files_final;
7083
7084 fwrite(&num_files_final, 4, 1, f);
7085 for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(data->files); ++i) {
7086 if (remap[data->files[i].dir] >= 0 && data->files[i].name) {
7087 stb_fput_ranged(f, remap[data->files[i].dir], 0, num_dirs_final);
7088 stb_fput_varlen64(f, data->files[i].size);
7089 fwrite(&data->files[i].last_modified, 4, 1, f);
7090 stb_fput_string(f, data->files[i].name);
7091 }
7092 }
7093
7094 fclose(f);
7095}
7096
7097// note: stomps any existing data, rather than appending
7098static void stb__dirtree_load_db(char *filename, stb_dirtree *data, char *dir)
7099{
7100 char sig[2048];
7101 int i,n;
7102 FILE *f = stb_p_fopen(filename, "rb");
7103
7104 if (!f) return;
7105
7106 data->string_pool = stb_malloc(0,1);
7107
7108 fread(sig, sizeof(stb__signature), 1, f);
7109 if (memcmp(stb__signature, sig, sizeof(stb__signature))) { fclose(f); return; }
7110 if (!fread(sig, strlen(dir)+1, 1, f)) { fclose(f); return; }
7111 if (stb_stricmp(sig,dir)) { fclose(f); return; }
7112
7113 // we can just read them straight in, because they're guaranteed to be valid
7114 fread(&n, 4, 1, f);
7115 stb_arr_setlen(data->dirs, n);
7116 for(i=0; i < stb_arr_len(data->dirs); ++i) {
7117 fread(&data->dirs[i].last_modified, 4, 1, f);
7118 data->dirs[i].path = stb_fget_string(f, data->string_pool);
7119 if (data->dirs[i].path == NULL) goto bail;
7120 }
7121 fread(&n, 4, 1, f);
7122 stb_arr_setlen(data->files, n);
7123 for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(data->files); ++i) {
7124 data->files[i].dir = stb_fget_ranged(f, 0, stb_arr_len(data->dirs));
7125 data->files[i].size = stb_fget_varlen64(f);
7126 fread(&data->files[i].last_modified, 4, 1, f);
7127 data->files[i].name = stb_fget_string(f, data->string_pool);
7128 if (data->files[i].name == NULL) goto bail;
7129 }
7130
7131 if (0) {
7132 bail:
7133 stb_arr_free(data->dirs);
7134 stb_arr_free(data->files);
7135 }
7136 fclose(f);
7137}
7138
7139FILE *hlog;
7140
7141static int stb__dircount, stb__dircount_mask, stb__showfile;
7142static void stb__dirtree_scandir(char *path, time_t last_time, stb_dirtree *active)
7143{
7144 // this is dumb depth first; theoretically it might be faster
7145 // to fully traverse each directory before visiting its children,
7146 // but it's complicated and didn't seem like a gain in the test app
7147
7148 int n;
7149
7150 struct _wfinddatai64_t c_file;
7151 long hFile;
7152 stb__wchar full_path[1024];
7153 int has_slash;
7154 if (stb__showfile) printf("<");
7155
7156 has_slash = (path[0] && path[strlen(path)-1] == '/');
7157
7158 // @TODO: do this concatenation without using swprintf to avoid this mess:
7159#if (defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER < 1400) // || (defined(__clang__))
7160 // confusingly, Windows Kits\10 needs to go down this path?!?
7161 // except now it doesn't, I don't know what changed
7162 if (has_slash)
7163 swprintf(full_path, L"%s*", stb__from_utf8(path));
7164 else
7165 swprintf(full_path, L"%s/*", stb__from_utf8(path));
7166#else
7167 if (has_slash)
7168 swprintf((wchar_t *) full_path, (size_t) 1024, L"%s*", (wchar_t *) stb__from_utf8(path));
7169 else
7170 swprintf((wchar_t *) full_path, (size_t) 1024, L"%s/*", (wchar_t *) stb__from_utf8(path));
7171#endif
7172
7173 // it's possible this directory is already present: that means it was in the
7174 // cache, but its parent wasn't... in that case, we're done with it
7175 if (stb__showfile) printf("C[%d]", stb_arr_len(active->dirs));
7176 for (n=0; n < stb_arr_len(active->dirs); ++n)
7177 if (0 == stb_stricmp(active->dirs[n].path, path)) {
7178 if (stb__showfile) printf("D");
7179 return;
7180 }
7181 if (stb__showfile) printf("E");
7182
7183 // otherwise, we need to add it
7184 stb__dirtree_add_dir(path, last_time, active);
7185 n = stb_arr_lastn(active->dirs);
7186
7187 if (stb__showfile) printf("[");
7188 if( (hFile = (long) _wfindfirsti64( (wchar_t *) full_path, &c_file )) != -1L ) {
7189 do {
7190 if (stb__showfile) printf(")");
7191 if (c_file.attrib & _A_SUBDIR) {
7192 // ignore subdirectories starting with '.', e.g. "." and ".."
7193 if (c_file.name[0] != '.') {
7194 char *new_path = (char *) full_path;
7195 char *temp = stb__to_utf8((stb__wchar *) c_file.name);
7196
7197 if (has_slash)
7198 stb_p_sprintf(new_path stb_p_size(sizeof(full_path)), "%s%s", path, temp);
7199 else
7200 stb_p_sprintf(new_path stb_p_size(sizeof(full_path)), "%s/%s", path, temp);
7201
7202 if (stb__dircount_mask) {
7203 ++stb__dircount;
7204 if (!(stb__dircount & stb__dircount_mask)) {
7205 char dummy_path[128], *pad;
7206 stb_strncpy(dummy_path, new_path, sizeof(dummy_path)-1);
7207 if (strlen(dummy_path) > 96) {
7208 stb_p_strcpy_s(dummy_path+96/2-1,128, "...");
7209 stb_p_strcpy_s(dummy_path+96/2+2,128, new_path + strlen(new_path)-96/2+2);
7210 }
7211 pad = dummy_path + strlen(dummy_path);
7212 while (pad < dummy_path+98)
7213 *pad++ = ' ';
7214 *pad = 0;
7215 printf("%s\r", dummy_path);
7216 #if 0
7217 if (hlog == 0) {
7218 hlog = stb_p_fopen("c:/x/temp.log", "w");
7219 fprintf(hlog, "%s\n", dummy_path);
7220 }
7221 #endif
7222 }
7223 }
7224
7225 stb__dirtree_scandir(new_path, c_file.time_write, active);
7226 }
7227 } else {
7228 char *temp = stb__to_utf8((stb__wchar *) c_file.name);
7229 stb__dirtree_add_file(temp, n, c_file.size, c_file.time_write, active);
7230 }
7231 if (stb__showfile) printf("(");
7232 } while( _wfindnexti64( hFile, &c_file ) == 0 );
7233 if (stb__showfile) printf("]");
7234 _findclose( hFile );
7235 }
7236 if (stb__showfile) printf(">\n");
7237}
7238
7239// scan the database and see if it's all valid
7240static int stb__dirtree_update_db(stb_dirtree *db, stb_dirtree *active)
7241{
7242 int changes_detected = STB_FALSE;
7243 int i;
7244 int *remap;
7245 int *rescan=NULL;
7246 remap = (int *) malloc(sizeof(remap[0]) * stb_arr_len(db->dirs));
7247 memset(remap, 0, sizeof(remap[0]) * stb_arr_len(db->dirs));
7248 rescan = NULL;
7249
7250 for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(db->dirs); ++i) {
7251 struct _stat info;
7252 if (stb__dircount_mask) {
7253 ++stb__dircount;
7254 if (!(stb__dircount & stb__dircount_mask)) {
7255 printf(".");
7256 }
7257 }
7258 if (0 == _stat(db->dirs[i].path, &info)) {
7259 if (info.st_mode & _S_IFDIR) {
7260 // it's still a directory, as expected
7261 int n = abs((int) (info.st_mtime - db->dirs[i].last_modified));
7262 if (n > 1 && n != 3600) { // the 3600 is a hack because sometimes this jumps for no apparent reason, even when no time zone or DST issues are at play
7263 // it's changed! force a rescan
7264 // we don't want to scan it until we've stat()d its
7265 // subdirs, though, so we queue it
7266 if (stb__showfile) printf("Changed: %s - %08x:%08x\n", db->dirs[i].path, (unsigned int) db->dirs[i].last_modified, (unsigned int) info.st_mtime);
7267 stb_arr_push(rescan, i);
7268 // update the last_mod time
7269 db->dirs[i].last_modified = info.st_mtime;
7270 // ignore existing files in this dir
7271 remap[i] = -1;
7272 changes_detected = STB_TRUE;
7273 } else {
7274 // it hasn't changed, just copy it through unchanged
7275 stb__dirtree_add_dir(db->dirs[i].path, db->dirs[i].last_modified, active);
7276 remap[i] = stb_arr_lastn(active->dirs);
7277 }
7278 } else {
7279 // this path used to refer to a directory, but now it's a file!
7280 // assume that the parent directory is going to be forced to rescan anyway
7281 goto delete_entry;
7282 }
7283 } else {
7284 delete_entry:
7285 // directory no longer exists, so don't copy it
7286 // we don't free it because it's in the string pool now
7287 db->dirs[i].path = NULL;
7288 remap[i] = -1;
7289 changes_detected = STB_TRUE;
7290 }
7291 }
7292
7293 // at this point, we have:
7294 //
7295 // <rescan> holds a list of directory indices that need to be scanned due to being out of date
7296 // <remap> holds the directory index in <active> for each dir in <db>, if it exists; -1 if not
7297 // directories in <rescan> are not in <active> yet
7298
7299 // so we can go ahead and remap all the known files right now
7300 for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(db->files); ++i) {
7301 int dir = db->files[i].dir;
7302 if (remap[dir] >= 0) {
7303 stb__dirtree_add_file(db->files[i].name, remap[dir], db->files[i].size, db->files[i].last_modified, active);
7304 }
7305 }
7306
7307 // at this point we're done with db->files, and done with remap
7308 free(remap);
7309
7310 // now scan those directories using the standard scan
7311 for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(rescan); ++i) {
7312 int z = rescan[i];
7313 stb__dirtree_scandir(db->dirs[z].path, db->dirs[z].last_modified, active);
7314 }
7315 stb_arr_free(rescan);
7316
7317 return changes_detected;
7318}
7319
7320static void stb__dirtree_free_raw(stb_dirtree *d)
7321{
7322 stb_free(d->string_pool);
7323 stb_arr_free(d->dirs);
7324 stb_arr_free(d->files);
7325}
7326
7327stb_dirtree *stb_dirtree_get_with_file(char *dir, char *cache_file)
7328{
7329 stb_dirtree *output = (stb_dirtree *) malloc(sizeof(*output));
7330 stb_dirtree db,active;
7331 int prev_dir_count, cache_mismatch;
7332
7333 char *stripped_dir; // store the directory name without a trailing '/' or '\\'
7334
7335 // load the database of last-known state on disk
7336 db.string_pool = NULL;
7337 db.files = NULL;
7338 db.dirs = NULL;
7339
7340 stripped_dir = stb_strip_final_slash(stb_p_strdup(dir));
7341
7342 if (cache_file != NULL)
7343 stb__dirtree_load_db(cache_file, &db, stripped_dir);
7344 else if (stb__showfile)
7345 printf("No cache file\n");
7346
7347 active.files = NULL;
7348 active.dirs = NULL;
7349 active.string_pool = stb_malloc(0,1); // @TODO: share string pools between both?
7350
7351 // check all the directories in the database; make note if
7352 // anything we scanned had changed, and rescan those things
7353 cache_mismatch = stb__dirtree_update_db(&db, &active);
7354
7355 // check the root tree
7356 prev_dir_count = stb_arr_len(active.dirs); // record how many directories we've seen
7357
7358 stb__dirtree_scandir(stripped_dir, 0, &active); // no last_modified time available for root
7359
7360 if (stb__dircount_mask)
7361 printf(" \r");
7362
7363 // done with the DB; write it back out if any changes, i.e. either
7364 // 1. any inconsistency found between cached information and actual disk
7365 // or 2. if scanning the root found any new directories--which we detect because
7366 // more than one directory got added to the active db during that scan
7367 if (cache_mismatch || stb_arr_len(active.dirs) > prev_dir_count+1)
7368 stb__dirtree_save_db(cache_file, &active, stripped_dir);
7369
7370 free(stripped_dir);
7371
7372 stb__dirtree_free_raw(&db);
7373
7374 *output = active;
7375 return output;
7376}
7377
7378stb_dirtree *stb_dirtree_get_dir(char *dir, char *cache_dir)
7379{
7380 int i;
7381 stb_uint8 sha[20];
7382 char dir_lower[1024];
7383 char cache_file[1024],*s;
7384 if (cache_dir == NULL)
7385 return stb_dirtree_get_with_file(dir, NULL);
7386 stb_p_strcpy_s(dir_lower, sizeof(dir_lower), dir);
7387 stb_tolower(dir_lower);
7388 stb_sha1(sha, (unsigned char *) dir_lower, (unsigned int) strlen(dir_lower));
7389 stb_p_strcpy_s(cache_file, sizeof(cache_file), cache_dir);
7390 s = cache_file + strlen(cache_file);
7391 if (s[-1] != '/' && s[-1] != '\\') *s++ = '/';
7392 stb_p_strcpy_s(s, sizeof(cache_file), "dirtree_");
7393 s += strlen(s);
7394 for (i=0; i < 8; ++i) {
7395 char *hex = (char*)"0123456789abcdef";
7396 stb_uint z = sha[i];
7397 *s++ = hex[z >> 4];
7398 *s++ = hex[z & 15];
7399 }
7400 stb_p_strcpy_s(s, sizeof(cache_file), ".bin");
7401 return stb_dirtree_get_with_file(dir, cache_file);
7402}
7403
7404stb_dirtree *stb_dirtree_get(char *dir)
7405{
7406 char cache_dir[256];
7407 stb_p_strcpy_s(cache_dir, sizeof(cache_dir), "c:/bindata");
7408 #ifdef STB_HAS_REGISTRY
7409 {
7410 void *reg = stb_reg_open("rHKLM", "Software\\SilverSpaceship\\stb");
7411 if (reg) {
7412 stb_reg_read(reg, "dirtree", cache_dir, sizeof(cache_dir));
7413 stb_reg_close(reg);
7414 }
7415 }
7416 #endif
7417 return stb_dirtree_get_dir(dir, cache_dir);
7418}
7419
7420void stb_dirtree_free(stb_dirtree *d)
7421{
7422 stb__dirtree_free_raw(d);
7423 free(d);
7424}
7425
7426void stb_dirtree_db_add_dir(stb_dirtree *active, char *path, time_t last)
7427{
7428 stb__dirtree_add_dir(path, last, active);
7429}
7430
7431void stb_dirtree_db_add_file(stb_dirtree *active, char *name, int dir, stb_int64 size, time_t last)
7432{
7433 stb__dirtree_add_file(name, dir, size, last, active);
7434}
7435
7436void stb_dirtree_db_read(stb_dirtree *target, char *filename, char *dir)
7437{
7438 char *s = stb_strip_final_slash(stb_p_strdup(dir));
7439 target->dirs = 0;
7440 target->files = 0;
7441 target->string_pool = 0;
7442 stb__dirtree_load_db(filename, target, s);
7443 free(s);
7444}
7445
7446void stb_dirtree_db_write(stb_dirtree *target, char *filename, char *dir)
7447{
7448 stb__dirtree_save_db(filename, target, 0); // don't strip out any directories
7449}
7450
7451#endif // STB_DEFINE
7452
7453#endif // _WIN32
7454#endif // STB_NO_STB_STRINGS
7455
7457//
7458// STB_MALLOC_WRAPPER
7459//
7460// you can use the wrapper functions with your own malloc wrapper,
7461// or define STB_MALLOC_WRAPPER project-wide to have
7462// malloc/free/realloc/strdup all get vectored to it
7463
7464// this has too many very specific error messages you could google for and find in stb.h,
7465// so don't use it if they don't want any stb.h-identifiable strings
7466#if defined(STB_DEFINE) && !defined(STB_NO_STB_STRINGS)
7467
7468typedef struct
7469{
7470 void *p;
7471 char *file;
7472 int line;
7473 size_t size;
7474} stb_malloc_record;
7475
7476#ifndef STB_MALLOC_HISTORY_COUNT
7477#define STB_MALLOC_HISTORY_COUNT 50 // 800 bytes
7478#endif
7479
7480stb_malloc_record *stb__allocations;
7481static int stb__alloc_size, stb__alloc_limit, stb__alloc_mask;
7482int stb__alloc_count;
7483
7484stb_malloc_record stb__alloc_history[STB_MALLOC_HISTORY_COUNT];
7485int stb__history_pos;
7486
7487static int stb__hashfind(void *p)
7488{
7489 stb_uint32 h = stb_hashptr(p);
7490 int s,n = h & stb__alloc_mask;
7491 if (stb__allocations[n].p == p)
7492 return n;
7493 s = stb_rehash(h)|1;
7494 for(;;) {
7495 if (stb__allocations[n].p == NULL)
7496 return -1;
7497 n = (n+s) & stb__alloc_mask;
7498 if (stb__allocations[n].p == p)
7499 return n;
7500 }
7501}
7502
7503size_t stb_wrapper_allocsize(void *p)
7504{
7505 int n = stb__hashfind(p);
7506 if (n < 0) return 0;
7507 return stb__allocations[n].size;
7508}
7509
7510static int stb__historyfind(void *p)
7511{
7512 int n = stb__history_pos;
7513 int i;
7514 for (i=0; i < STB_MALLOC_HISTORY_COUNT; ++i) {
7515 if (--n < 0) n = STB_MALLOC_HISTORY_COUNT-1;
7516 if (stb__alloc_history[n].p == p)
7517 return n;
7518 }
7519 return -1;
7520}
7521
7522static void stb__add_alloc(void *p, size_t sz, char *file, int line);
7523static void stb__grow_alloc(void)
7524{
7525 int i,old_num = stb__alloc_size;
7526 stb_malloc_record *old = stb__allocations;
7527 if (stb__alloc_size == 0)
7528 stb__alloc_size = 64;
7529 else
7530 stb__alloc_size *= 2;
7531
7532 stb__allocations = (stb_malloc_record *) stb__realloc_raw(NULL, stb__alloc_size * sizeof(stb__allocations[0]));
7533 if (stb__allocations == NULL)
7534 stb_fatal("Internal error: couldn't grow malloc wrapper table");
7535 memset(stb__allocations, 0, stb__alloc_size * sizeof(stb__allocations[0]));
7536 stb__alloc_limit = (stb__alloc_size*3)>>2;
7537 stb__alloc_mask = stb__alloc_size-1;
7538
7539 stb__alloc_count = 0;
7540
7541 for (i=0; i < old_num; ++i)
7542 if (old[i].p > STB_DEL) {
7543 stb__add_alloc(old[i].p, old[i].size, old[i].file, old[i].line);
7544 assert(stb__hashfind(old[i].p) >= 0);
7545 }
7546 for (i=0; i < old_num; ++i)
7547 if (old[i].p > STB_DEL)
7548 assert(stb__hashfind(old[i].p) >= 0);
7549 stb__realloc_raw(old, 0);
7550}
7551
7552static void stb__add_alloc(void *p, size_t sz, char *file, int line)
7553{
7554 stb_uint32 h;
7555 int n;
7556 if (stb__alloc_count >= stb__alloc_limit)
7557 stb__grow_alloc();
7558 h = stb_hashptr(p);
7559 n = h & stb__alloc_mask;
7560 if (stb__allocations[n].p > STB_DEL) {
7561 int s = stb_rehash(h)|1;
7562 do {
7563 n = (n+s) & stb__alloc_mask;
7564 } while (stb__allocations[n].p > STB_DEL);
7565 }
7566 assert(stb__allocations[n].p == NULL || stb__allocations[n].p == STB_DEL);
7567 stb__allocations[n].p = p;
7568 stb__allocations[n].size = sz;
7569 stb__allocations[n].line = line;
7570 stb__allocations[n].file = file;
7571 ++stb__alloc_count;
7572}
7573
7574static void stb__remove_alloc(int n, char *file, int line)
7575{
7576 stb__alloc_history[stb__history_pos] = stb__allocations[n];
7577 stb__alloc_history[stb__history_pos].file = file;
7578 stb__alloc_history[stb__history_pos].line = line;
7579 if (++stb__history_pos == STB_MALLOC_HISTORY_COUNT)
7580 stb__history_pos = 0;
7581 stb__allocations[n].p = STB_DEL;
7582 --stb__alloc_count;
7583}
7584
7585void stb_wrapper_malloc(void *p, size_t sz, char *file, int line)
7586{
7587 if (!p) return;
7588 stb__add_alloc(p,sz,file,line);
7589}
7590
7591void stb_wrapper_free(void *p, char *file, int line)
7592{
7593 int n;
7594
7595 if (p == NULL) return;
7596
7597 n = stb__hashfind(p);
7598
7599 if (n >= 0)
7600 stb__remove_alloc(n, file, line);
7601 else {
7602 // tried to free something we hadn't allocated!
7603 n = stb__historyfind(p);
7604 assert(0); /* NOTREACHED */
7605 if (n >= 0)
7606 stb_fatal("Attempted to free %d-byte block %p at %s:%d previously freed/realloced at %s:%d",
7607 stb__alloc_history[n].size, p,
7608 file, line,
7609 stb__alloc_history[n].file, stb__alloc_history[n].line);
7610 else
7611 stb_fatal("Attempted to free unknown block %p at %s:%d", p, file,line);
7612 }
7613}
7614
7615void stb_wrapper_check(void *p)
7616{
7617 int n;
7618
7619 if (p == NULL) return;
7620
7621 n = stb__hashfind(p);
7622
7623 if (n >= 0) return;
7624
7625 for (n=0; n < stb__alloc_size; ++n)
7626 if (stb__allocations[n].p == p)
7627 stb_fatal("Internal error: pointer %p was allocated, but hash search failed", p);
7628
7629 // tried to free something that wasn't allocated!
7630 n = stb__historyfind(p);
7631 if (n >= 0)
7632 stb_fatal("Checked %d-byte block %p previously freed/realloced at %s:%d",
7633 stb__alloc_history[n].size, p,
7634 stb__alloc_history[n].file, stb__alloc_history[n].line);
7635 stb_fatal("Checked unknown block %p");
7636}
7637
7638void stb_wrapper_realloc(void *p, void *q, size_t sz, char *file, int line)
7639{
7640 int n;
7641 if (p == NULL) { stb_wrapper_malloc(q, sz, file, line); return; }
7642 if (q == NULL) return; // nothing happened
7643
7644 n = stb__hashfind(p);
7645 if (n == -1) {
7646 // tried to free something we hadn't allocated!
7647 // this is weird, though, because we got past the realloc!
7648 n = stb__historyfind(p);
7649 assert(0); /* NOTREACHED */
7650 if (n >= 0)
7651 stb_fatal("Attempted to realloc %d-byte block %p at %s:%d previously freed/realloced at %s:%d",
7652 stb__alloc_history[n].size, p,
7653 file, line,
7654 stb__alloc_history[n].file, stb__alloc_history[n].line);
7655 else
7656 stb_fatal("Attempted to realloc unknown block %p at %s:%d", p, file,line);
7657 } else {
7658 if (q == p) {
7659 stb__allocations[n].size = sz;
7660 stb__allocations[n].file = file;
7661 stb__allocations[n].line = line;
7662 } else {
7663 stb__remove_alloc(n, file, line);
7664 stb__add_alloc(q,sz,file,line);
7665 }
7666 }
7667}
7668
7669void stb_wrapper_listall(void (*func)(void *ptr, size_t sz, char *file, int line))
7670{
7671 int i;
7672 for (i=0; i < stb__alloc_size; ++i)
7673 if (stb__allocations[i].p > STB_DEL)
7674 func(stb__allocations[i].p , stb__allocations[i].size,
7675 stb__allocations[i].file, stb__allocations[i].line);
7676}
7677
7678void stb_wrapper_dump(char *filename)
7679{
7680 int i;
7681 FILE *f = stb_p_fopen(filename, "w");
7682 if (!f) return;
7683 for (i=0; i < stb__alloc_size; ++i)
7684 if (stb__allocations[i].p > STB_DEL)
7685 fprintf(f, "%p %7d - %4d %s\n",
7686 stb__allocations[i].p , (int) stb__allocations[i].size,
7687 stb__allocations[i].line, stb__allocations[i].file);
7688}
7689#endif // STB_DEFINE
7690
7691
7693//
7694// stb_pointer_set
7695//
7696//
7697// For data structures that support querying by key, data structure
7698// classes always hand-wave away the issue of what to do if two entries
7699// have the same key: basically, store a linked list of all the nodes
7700// which have the same key (a LISP-style list).
7701//
7702// The thing is, it's not that trivial. If you have an O(log n)
7703// lookup data structure, but then n/4 items have the same value,
7704// you don't want to spend O(n) time scanning that list when
7705// deleting an item if you already have a pointer to the item.
7706// (You have to spend O(n) time enumerating all the items with
7707// a given key, sure, and you can't accelerate deleting a particular
7708// item if you only have the key, not a pointer to the item.)
7709//
7710// I'm going to call this data structure, whatever it turns out to
7711// be, a "pointer set", because we don't store any associated data for
7712// items in this data structure, we just answer the question of
7713// whether an item is in it or not (it's effectively one bit per pointer).
7714// Technically they don't have to be pointers; you could cast ints
7715// to (void *) if you want, but you can't store 0 or 1 because of the
7716// hash table.
7717//
7718// Since the fastest data structure we might want to add support for
7719// identical-keys to is a hash table with O(1)-ish lookup time,
7720// that means that the conceptual "linked list of all items with
7721// the same indexed value" that we build needs to have the same
7722// performance; that way when we index a table we think is arbitrary
7723// ints, but in fact half of them are 0, we don't get screwed.
7724//
7725// Therefore, it needs to be a hash table, at least when it gets
7726// large. On the other hand, when the data has totally arbitrary ints
7727// or floats, there won't be many collisions, and we'll have tons of
7728// 1-item bitmaps. That will be grossly inefficient as hash tables;
7729// trade-off; the hash table is reasonably efficient per-item when
7730// it's large, but not when it's small. So we need to do something
7731// Judy-like and use different strategies depending on the size.
7732//
7733// Like Judy, we'll use the bottom bit to encode the strategy:
7734//
7735// bottom bits:
7736// 00 - direct pointer
7737// 01 - 4-item bucket (16 bytes, no length, NULLs)
7738// 10 - N-item array
7739// 11 - hash table
7740
7741typedef struct stb_ps stb_ps;
7742
7743STB_EXTERN int stb_ps_find (stb_ps *ps, void *value);
7744STB_EXTERN stb_ps * stb_ps_add (stb_ps *ps, void *value);
7745STB_EXTERN stb_ps * stb_ps_remove(stb_ps *ps, void *value);
7746STB_EXTERN stb_ps * stb_ps_remove_any(stb_ps *ps, void **value);
7747STB_EXTERN void stb_ps_delete(stb_ps *ps);
7748STB_EXTERN int stb_ps_count (stb_ps *ps);
7749
7750STB_EXTERN stb_ps * stb_ps_copy (stb_ps *ps);
7751STB_EXTERN int stb_ps_subset(stb_ps *bigger, stb_ps *smaller);
7752STB_EXTERN int stb_ps_eq (stb_ps *p0, stb_ps *p1);
7753
7754STB_EXTERN void ** stb_ps_getlist (stb_ps *ps, int *count);
7755STB_EXTERN int stb_ps_writelist(stb_ps *ps, void **list, int size );
7756
7757// enum and fastlist don't allocate storage, but you must consume the
7758// list before there's any chance the data structure gets screwed up;
7759STB_EXTERN int stb_ps_enum (stb_ps *ps, void *data,
7760 int (*func)(void *value, void*data) );
7761STB_EXTERN void ** stb_ps_fastlist(stb_ps *ps, int *count);
7762// result:
7763// returns a list, *count is the length of that list,
7764// but some entries of the list may be invalid;
7765// test with 'stb_ps_fastlist_valid(x)'
7766
7767#define stb_ps_fastlist_valid(x) ((stb_uinta) (x) > 1)
7768
7769#ifdef STB_DEFINE
7770
7771enum
7772{
7773 STB_ps_direct = 0,
7774 STB_ps_bucket = 1,
7775 STB_ps_array = 2,
7776 STB_ps_hash = 3,
7777};
7778
7779#define STB_BUCKET_SIZE 4
7780
7781typedef struct
7782{
7783 void *p[STB_BUCKET_SIZE];
7784} stb_ps_bucket;
7785#define GetBucket(p) ((stb_ps_bucket *) ((char *) (p) - STB_ps_bucket))
7786#define EncodeBucket(p) ((stb_ps *) ((char *) (p) + STB_ps_bucket))
7787
7788static void stb_bucket_free(stb_ps_bucket *b)
7789{
7790 free(b);
7791}
7792
7793static stb_ps_bucket *stb_bucket_create2(void *v0, void *v1)
7794{
7795 stb_ps_bucket *b = (stb_ps_bucket*) malloc(sizeof(*b));
7796 b->p[0] = v0;
7797 b->p[1] = v1;
7798 b->p[2] = NULL;
7799 b->p[3] = NULL;
7800 return b;
7801}
7802
7803static stb_ps_bucket * stb_bucket_create3(void **v)
7804{
7805 stb_ps_bucket *b = (stb_ps_bucket*) malloc(sizeof(*b));
7806 b->p[0] = v[0];
7807 b->p[1] = v[1];
7808 b->p[2] = v[2];
7809 b->p[3] = NULL;
7810 return b;
7811}
7812
7813
7814// could use stb_arr, but this will save us memory
7815typedef struct
7816{
7817 int count;
7818 void *p[1];
7819} stb_ps_array;
7820#define GetArray(p) ((stb_ps_array *) ((char *) (p) - STB_ps_array))
7821#define EncodeArray(p) ((stb_ps *) ((char *) (p) + STB_ps_array))
7822
7823static int stb_ps_array_max = 13;
7824
7825typedef struct
7826{
7827 int size, mask;
7828 int count, count_deletes;
7829 int grow_threshhold;
7830 int shrink_threshhold;
7831 int rehash_threshhold;
7832 int any_offset;
7833 void *table[1];
7834} stb_ps_hash;
7835#define GetHash(p) ((stb_ps_hash *) ((char *) (p) - STB_ps_hash))
7836#define EncodeHash(p) ((stb_ps *) ((char *) (p) + STB_ps_hash))
7837
7838#define stb_ps_empty(v) (((stb_uint32) v) <= 1)
7839
7840static stb_ps_hash *stb_ps_makehash(int size, int old_size, void **old_data)
7841{
7842 int i;
7843 stb_ps_hash *h = (stb_ps_hash *) malloc(sizeof(*h) + (size-1) * sizeof(h->table[0]));
7844 assert(stb_is_pow2(size));
7845 h->size = size;
7846 h->mask = size-1;
7847 h->shrink_threshhold = (int) (0.3f * size);
7848 h-> grow_threshhold = (int) (0.8f * size);
7849 h->rehash_threshhold = (int) (0.9f * size);
7850 h->count = 0;
7851 h->count_deletes = 0;
7852 h->any_offset = 0;
7853 memset(h->table, 0, size * sizeof(h->table[0]));
7854 for (i=0; i < old_size; ++i)
7855 if (!stb_ps_empty((size_t)old_data[i]))
7856 stb_ps_add(EncodeHash(h), old_data[i]);
7857 return h;
7858}
7859
7860void stb_ps_delete(stb_ps *ps)
7861{
7862 switch (3 & (int)(size_t) ps) {
7863 case STB_ps_direct: break;
7864 case STB_ps_bucket: stb_bucket_free(GetBucket(ps)); break;
7865 case STB_ps_array : free(GetArray(ps)); break;
7866 case STB_ps_hash : free(GetHash(ps)); break;
7867 }
7868}
7869
7870stb_ps *stb_ps_copy(stb_ps *ps)
7871{
7872 int i;
7873 // not a switch: order based on expected performance/power-law distribution
7874 switch (3 & (int)(size_t) ps) {
7875 case STB_ps_direct: return ps;
7876 case STB_ps_bucket: {
7877 stb_ps_bucket *n = (stb_ps_bucket *) malloc(sizeof(*n));
7878 *n = *GetBucket(ps);
7879 return EncodeBucket(n);
7880 }
7881 case STB_ps_array: {
7882 stb_ps_array *a = GetArray(ps);
7883 stb_ps_array *n = (stb_ps_array *) malloc(sizeof(*n) + stb_ps_array_max * sizeof(n->p[0]));
7884 n->count = a->count;
7885 for (i=0; i < a->count; ++i)
7886 n->p[i] = a->p[i];
7887 return EncodeArray(n);
7888 }
7889 case STB_ps_hash: {
7890 stb_ps_hash *h = GetHash(ps);
7891 stb_ps_hash *n = stb_ps_makehash(h->size, h->size, h->table);
7892 return EncodeHash(n);
7893 }
7894 }
7895 assert(0); /* NOTREACHED */
7896 return NULL;
7897}
7898
7899int stb_ps_find(stb_ps *ps, void *value)
7900{
7901 int i, code = 3 & (int)(size_t) ps;
7902 assert((3 & (int)(size_t) value) == STB_ps_direct);
7903 assert(stb_ps_fastlist_valid(value));
7904 // not a switch: order based on expected performance/power-law distribution
7905 if (code == STB_ps_direct)
7906 return value == ps;
7907 if (code == STB_ps_bucket) {
7908 stb_ps_bucket *b = GetBucket(ps);
7909 assert(STB_BUCKET_SIZE == 4);
7910 if (b->p[0] == value || b->p[1] == value ||
7911 b->p[2] == value || b->p[3] == value)
7912 return STB_TRUE;
7913 return STB_FALSE;
7914 }
7915 if (code == STB_ps_array) {
7916 stb_ps_array *a = GetArray(ps);
7917 for (i=0; i < a->count; ++i)
7918 if (a->p[i] == value)
7919 return STB_TRUE;
7920 return STB_FALSE;
7921 } else {
7922 stb_ps_hash *h = GetHash(ps);
7923 stb_uint32 hash = stb_hashptr(value);
7924 stb_uint32 s, n = hash & h->mask;
7925 void **t = h->table;
7926 if (t[n] == value) return STB_TRUE;
7927 if (t[n] == NULL) return STB_FALSE;
7928 s = stb_rehash(hash) | 1;
7929 do {
7930 n = (n + s) & h->mask;
7931 if (t[n] == value) return STB_TRUE;
7932 } while (t[n] != NULL);
7933 return STB_FALSE;
7934 }
7935}
7936
7937stb_ps * stb_ps_add (stb_ps *ps, void *value)
7938{
7939 #ifdef STB_DEBUG
7940 assert(!stb_ps_find(ps,value));
7941 #endif
7942 if (value == NULL) return ps; // ignore NULL adds to avoid bad breakage
7943 assert((3 & (int)(size_t) value) == STB_ps_direct);
7944 assert(stb_ps_fastlist_valid(value));
7945 assert(value != STB_DEL); // STB_DEL is less likely
7946
7947 switch (3 & (int)(size_t) ps) {
7948 case STB_ps_direct:
7949 if (ps == NULL) return (stb_ps *) value;
7950 return EncodeBucket(stb_bucket_create2(ps,value));
7951
7952 case STB_ps_bucket: {
7953 stb_ps_bucket *b = GetBucket(ps);
7954 stb_ps_array *a;
7955 assert(STB_BUCKET_SIZE == 4);
7956 if (b->p[0] == NULL) { b->p[0] = value; return ps; }
7957 if (b->p[1] == NULL) { b->p[1] = value; return ps; }
7958 if (b->p[2] == NULL) { b->p[2] = value; return ps; }
7959 if (b->p[3] == NULL) { b->p[3] = value; return ps; }
7960 a = (stb_ps_array *) malloc(sizeof(*a) + 7 * sizeof(a->p[0])); // 8 slots, must be 2^k
7961 memcpy(a->p, b, sizeof(*b));
7962 a->p[4] = value;
7963 a->count = 5;
7964 stb_bucket_free(b);
7965 return EncodeArray(a);
7966 }
7967
7968 case STB_ps_array: {
7969 stb_ps_array *a = GetArray(ps);
7970 if (a->count == stb_ps_array_max) {
7971 // promote from array to hash
7972 stb_ps_hash *h = stb_ps_makehash(2 << stb_log2_ceil(a->count), a->count, a->p);
7973 free(a);
7974 return stb_ps_add(EncodeHash(h), value);
7975 }
7976 // do we need to resize the array? the array doubles in size when it
7977 // crosses a power-of-two
7978 if ((a->count & (a->count-1))==0) {
7979 int newsize = a->count*2;
7980 // clamp newsize to max if:
7981 // 1. it's larger than max
7982 // 2. newsize*1.5 is larger than max (to avoid extra resizing)
7983 if (newsize + a->count > stb_ps_array_max)
7984 newsize = stb_ps_array_max;
7985 a = (stb_ps_array *) realloc(a, sizeof(*a) + (newsize-1) * sizeof(a->p[0]));
7986 }
7987 a->p[a->count++] = value;
7988 return EncodeArray(a);
7989 }
7990 case STB_ps_hash: {
7991 stb_ps_hash *h = GetHash(ps);
7992 stb_uint32 hash = stb_hashptr(value);
7993 stb_uint32 n = hash & h->mask;
7994 void **t = h->table;
7995 // find first NULL or STB_DEL entry
7996 if (!stb_ps_empty((size_t)t[n])) {
7997 stb_uint32 s = stb_rehash(hash) | 1;
7998 do {
7999 n = (n + s) & h->mask;
8000 } while (!stb_ps_empty((size_t)t[n]));
8001 }
8002 if (t[n] == STB_DEL)
8003 -- h->count_deletes;
8004 t[n] = value;
8005 ++ h->count;
8006 if (h->count == h->grow_threshhold) {
8007 stb_ps_hash *h2 = stb_ps_makehash(h->size*2, h->size, t);
8008 free(h);
8009 return EncodeHash(h2);
8010 }
8011 if (h->count + h->count_deletes == h->rehash_threshhold) {
8012 stb_ps_hash *h2 = stb_ps_makehash(h->size, h->size, t);
8013 free(h);
8014 return EncodeHash(h2);
8015 }
8016 return ps;
8017 }
8018 }
8019 return NULL; /* NOTREACHED */
8020}
8021
8022stb_ps *stb_ps_remove(stb_ps *ps, void *value)
8023{
8024 #ifdef STB_DEBUG
8025 assert(stb_ps_find(ps, value));
8026 #endif
8027 assert((3 & (int)(size_t) value) == STB_ps_direct);
8028 if (value == NULL) return ps; // ignore NULL removes to avoid bad breakage
8029 switch (3 & (int)(size_t) ps) {
8030 case STB_ps_direct:
8031 return ps == value ? NULL : ps;
8032 case STB_ps_bucket: {
8033 stb_ps_bucket *b = GetBucket(ps);
8034 int count=0;
8035 assert(STB_BUCKET_SIZE == 4);
8036 if (b->p[0] == value) b->p[0] = NULL; else count += (b->p[0] != NULL);
8037 if (b->p[1] == value) b->p[1] = NULL; else count += (b->p[1] != NULL);
8038 if (b->p[2] == value) b->p[2] = NULL; else count += (b->p[2] != NULL);
8039 if (b->p[3] == value) b->p[3] = NULL; else count += (b->p[3] != NULL);
8040 if (count == 1) { // shrink bucket at size 1
8041 value = b->p[0];
8042 if (value == NULL) value = b->p[1];
8043 if (value == NULL) value = b->p[2];
8044 if (value == NULL) value = b->p[3];
8045 assert(value != NULL);
8046 stb_bucket_free(b);
8047 return (stb_ps *) value; // return STB_ps_direct of value
8048 }
8049 return ps;
8050 }
8051 case STB_ps_array: {
8052 stb_ps_array *a = GetArray(ps);
8053 int i;
8054 for (i=0; i < a->count; ++i) {
8055 if (a->p[i] == value) {
8056 a->p[i] = a->p[--a->count];
8057 if (a->count == 3) { // shrink to bucket!
8058 stb_ps_bucket *b = stb_bucket_create3(a->p);
8059 free(a);
8060 return EncodeBucket(b);
8061 }
8062 return ps;
8063 }
8064 }
8065 return ps;
8066 }
8067 case STB_ps_hash: {
8068 stb_ps_hash *h = GetHash(ps);
8069 stb_uint32 hash = stb_hashptr(value);
8070 stb_uint32 s, n = hash & h->mask;
8071 void **t = h->table;
8072 if (t[n] != value) {
8073 s = stb_rehash(hash) | 1;
8074 do {
8075 n = (n + s) & h->mask;
8076 } while (t[n] != value);
8077 }
8078 t[n] = STB_DEL;
8079 -- h->count;
8080 ++ h->count_deletes;
8081 // should we shrink down to an array?
8082 if (h->count < stb_ps_array_max) {
8083 int n = 1 << stb_log2_floor(stb_ps_array_max);
8084 if (h->count < n) {
8085 stb_ps_array *a = (stb_ps_array *) malloc(sizeof(*a) + (n-1) * sizeof(a->p[0]));
8086 int i,j=0;
8087 for (i=0; i < h->size; ++i)
8088 if (!stb_ps_empty((size_t)t[i]))
8089 a->p[j++] = t[i];
8090 assert(j == h->count);
8091 a->count = j;
8092 free(h);
8093 return EncodeArray(a);
8094 }
8095 }
8096 if (h->count == h->shrink_threshhold) {
8097 stb_ps_hash *h2 = stb_ps_makehash(h->size >> 1, h->size, t);
8098 free(h);
8099 return EncodeHash(h2);
8100 }
8101 return ps;
8102 }
8103 }
8104 return ps; /* NOTREACHED */
8105}
8106
8107stb_ps *stb_ps_remove_any(stb_ps *ps, void **value)
8108{
8109 assert(ps != NULL);
8110 switch (3 & (int)(size_t) ps) {
8111 case STB_ps_direct:
8112 *value = ps;
8113 return NULL;
8114 case STB_ps_bucket: {
8115 stb_ps_bucket *b = GetBucket(ps);
8116 int count=0, slast=0, last=0;
8117 assert(STB_BUCKET_SIZE == 4);
8118 if (b->p[0]) { ++count; last = 0; }
8119 if (b->p[1]) { ++count; slast = last; last = 1; }
8120 if (b->p[2]) { ++count; slast = last; last = 2; }
8121 if (b->p[3]) { ++count; slast = last; last = 3; }
8122 *value = b->p[last];
8123 b->p[last] = 0;
8124 if (count == 2) {
8125 void *leftover = b->p[slast]; // second to last
8126 stb_bucket_free(b);
8127 return (stb_ps *) leftover;
8128 }
8129 return ps;
8130 }
8131 case STB_ps_array: {
8132 stb_ps_array *a = GetArray(ps);
8133 *value = a->p[a->count-1];
8134 if (a->count == 4)
8135 return stb_ps_remove(ps, *value);
8136 --a->count;
8137 return ps;
8138 }
8139 case STB_ps_hash: {
8140 stb_ps_hash *h = GetHash(ps);
8141 void **t = h->table;
8142 stb_uint32 n = h->any_offset;
8143 while (stb_ps_empty((size_t)t[n]))
8144 n = (n + 1) & h->mask;
8145 *value = t[n];
8146 h->any_offset = (n+1) & h->mask;
8147 // check if we need to skip down to the previous type
8148 if (h->count-1 < stb_ps_array_max || h->count-1 == h->shrink_threshhold)
8149 return stb_ps_remove(ps, *value);
8150 t[n] = STB_DEL;
8151 -- h->count;
8152 ++ h->count_deletes;
8153 return ps;
8154 }
8155 }
8156 return ps; /* NOTREACHED */
8157}
8158
8159
8160void ** stb_ps_getlist(stb_ps *ps, int *count)
8161{
8162 int i,n=0;
8163 void **p = NULL;
8164 switch (3 & (int)(size_t) ps) {
8165 case STB_ps_direct:
8166 if (ps == NULL) { *count = 0; return NULL; }
8167 p = (void **) malloc(sizeof(*p) * 1);
8168 p[0] = ps;
8169 *count = 1;
8170 return p;
8171 case STB_ps_bucket: {
8172 stb_ps_bucket *b = GetBucket(ps);
8173 p = (void **) malloc(sizeof(*p) * STB_BUCKET_SIZE);
8174 for (i=0; i < STB_BUCKET_SIZE; ++i)
